body: Great idea. I'd like read only too. Have any suggestions for fuse apps with a good set of command line options I can look at?

https://github.com/yadayada/acd_cli/blob/master/acd_cli.py

I believe thats a complete mount option. The allow-other is something I could really use. It seems like the mounts are owned by root:root and not the user who executed the mount command. Is that normal?

On 28 August 2016 7:27:30 a.m. RXWatcher1 notifications@github.com wrote:

> https://github.com/yadayada/acd_cli/blob/master/acd_cli.py
> 
> I believe thats a complete mount option.

Thanks

> The allow-other is something I could really use. It seems like the mounts 
> are owned by root:root and not the user who executed the mount command. Is 
> that normal?

I didn't have any problems with Ubuntu 16.04 making and using the mounts.

Not at computer until next week so that is all I've got right now!

I would appreciate it if you can check if the mounts are owned by root when you get time. Mine are but I can write to them with the mount user. The issue I'm running into is my plex cant read them. Its setup as a different user/group than the user that mounted the rclone. It wont see into the mounts. If I unmount them then it will see into them so its the mount thats causing the issue. Thats where I think the allow-other would help. Thanks for all the efforts on this.
This is desperately needed, mounts are not visible in Kodi over SMB at all.

issue.title: mound only as root

issue.body:
the problem are when I mound it are only as root and then my docker plex server cant read it and SMB also cant see any file only from cmd can see the files :-(

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
> 1.33
> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
> Unraid
> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
> amazon cloud drive  (ACD)
> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
> rclone mount secret:/Plex/ /mnt/user/Tower/test/

sorry if this it not the place are new on github

body: @ncw AFAIK fuse mounts are visible to user who mounted them. When trying to access them over Samba which is not running as same user those are not visible. I briefly looked over the fuse library used and it seemed like it supports the options so it should be relatively easy to add the support (my go knowledge is zero). Any chance getting this on next release? :)

Here is a beta with as many fuse flags as I could find. See `rclone mount -h` to see them!

http://pub.rclone.org/v1.33-13-g7be4c3a-fuse-flags%CE%B2/
Just setup a mount last night that needs --allow-other. Perfect timing... will test when i get time, and report back.

EDIT:  Checked the beta one above.  The only ones missing that I use are suid and use_ino.  But I can't remember why I used use_ino and it might be specific to something I had an issue with in unionfs.  I can't think of a use case now for suid on a mounted cloud FS.  hmmm.

Yes I thought `suid` was probably not sensible on a cloud fs since rclone doesn't support custom permissions at all.

`use_ino` would mean rclone would have to make up inode numbers - might as well get fuse to do it so I think that option isn't useful.

Tested --allow-other with http://pub.rclone.org/v1.33-13-g7be4c3a-fuse-flags%CE%B2/
Working for me.

Thanks for this!

> mount helper error: fusermount: option allow_other only allowed if 'user_allow_other' is set in /etc/fuse.conf

I have option set in fuse.conf, user added into fuse group ... no idea why that happens
Ah, ubuntu has incorrect permissions as default and message was not indicating read issues. Works perfectly now!
Thanks for testing - I'll merge this to master now.

issue.title: fuse mount modules option
